quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Carrie and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, john, period. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What actress played the part of Carrie White in the movie “Carrie”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sissy Spacek

questions.question: What year did the horror film “Carrie” first hit the movie theatres?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1976

questions.question: The success of Sylvester Stallone came with the blockbuster Rocky. He wrote the movie and also played the lead role. How many days did it take him to write Rocky?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: In the movie “Carrie, Carries mom is killed in a manner that resembles crucifixion. She is crucified by Carrie and looks just like a small statue of a saint that is in their house. What is the name of the saint?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Sebastian

questions.question: The trademarks of Stallone- sarcastic smile, lazy eyes, and slurred speech, are the result of paralysis of the right side of his face.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What was the name of the high school that Carrie White attended in the 70s movie Carrie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bates High School

questions.question: In the movie Carrie, Carrie gets her first period while she is in the shower, she is horrified and has no idea what is happening to her. All the kids start laughing and throwing things at her. What do they start throwing at her?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Feminine napkins

questions.question: What actress played the role of Margaret White (Carrie’s mother) in the horror film “Carrie”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piper Laurie

questions.question: Teenage heartthrob John Travolta played Billy Nolan in the 70s horror movie Carrie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The success of Rocky was so great that Stallone returned to the franchise a number of times. He even directed Rocky II, III and IV. In 1982s Rocky III, this professional wrestler made his first mainstream exposure as Thunderlips.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hulk Hogan

questions.question: Sylvester Stallone was married to Sasha Czack (1974-1985) and to Brigitte Nielsen (1985-1987).  In 1997 he married this woman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jennifer Flavin

questions.question: Sylvester Stallone doesnt like his first name (this is true). When he was a kid, he decided to name himself Mike.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Sylvester Stallones other major success was First Blood,where he played the troubled Vietnam war veteran John Rambo. The movie was released in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1982

questions.question: Stallone has been awarded the Lifetime Achievement Award by the USA Academy of Science Fiction, Horror and Fantasy Films.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Sylvester Stallone also hosted a reality TV show called The Contender. What is the show about?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boxing

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Aladdin and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, heritage. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which is the first movie produced outside the USA or England to win the Academy Award for Best Picture?

options.text: The Bridge Over the River Kwai

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Last Emperor

questions.question: Which three movies have won the Top Five Awards i.e. for Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actor, Best Actress and Best Screenplay?

options.text: The Nuns Story, Gangs of New York and Peyton Place
Ben-Hur, Titanic, and The English Patient
Gigi, The Last Emperor  and The Color Purple
It Happened One Night, One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest, and The Silence of the Lambs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It Happened One Night, One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest, and The Silence of the Lambs

questions.question: Which of these movies, starring Tom Hanks won the most Oscars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forrest Gump

questions.question: What was the name of Jafars parrot in the Disney movie Aladdin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iago

questions.question: What is the name of the theme song for the movie Aladdin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arabian Nights

questions.question: In the horror classic “Carrie,” Carries mom thinks that Carrie got her first period because she was sinning. She sends her off to go pray. What part of the house does Carrie get sent to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The closet

questions.question: What is the name of Cassims right hand man in the Disney film Aladdin and the King of Thieves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saluk

questions.question: Which of the following characters from the movie Aladdin was voiced by Robin Williams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Genie

questions.question: How was the Genie set free in the Disney film Aladdin?

options.text: Aladdin freed him with his final wish.
He made Aladdin wish him free.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aladdin freed him with his final wish.

questions.question: The 70s movie Carrie is based on a novel written by this famous author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen King

questions.question: Who was the first actor of Latino-American heritage to win an Academy Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rita Moreno

questions.question: Aladdins father is the king of thieves.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Robin Williams provided the voice of Jafar in the animated feature Aladdin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: When was the animated feature Aladdin released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: November 25, 1992

questions.question: What is the third Aladdin movie made by Disney?

options.text: Aladdin and the King of Thieves

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aladdin and the King of Thieves

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and National Treasure
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, collections. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is silent movie is also the oldest on the American Film Institute (AFI) list of the Top 100 American films, and its ranked # 44.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Birth of a Nation

questions.question: In National Treasure, who plays Ian Howe, the treasure seeker who wants the treasure solely for the riches?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sean Bean

questions.question: In the movie National Treasure, what does Ben do to Jon Voights character, before leaving with the Declaration of Independence?

options.text: Ties him up with duct tape

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ties him up with duct tape

questions.question: Which movie won the 2005 Oscar for Best Documentary Feature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The March of the Penguins

questions.question: For which of the following two movies did Dustin Hoffman win Oscars?

options.text: Wag the Dog and Kramer vs. Kramer
Kramer vs. Kramer and Rain Man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kramer vs. Kramer and Rain Man

questions.question: In the 2004 film National Treasure, the lead character Ben Gates (Nicolas Cage) seeks the treasure for what purpose?

options.text: To clear his familys name and prove it does exist
To get his family out of debt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To clear his familys name and prove it does exist

questions.question: In the movie National Treasure, the first piece of the puzzle in the search for the treasure was a pipe. Where was it found?

options.text: In the clock tower under Big Ben

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In a ship

questions.question: Which of the earlier clues turns out to be the tool used to open the secret chamber in the movie National Treasure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pipe

questions.question: In 2002, this actor was nominated by The Academy for the 12th time, thus becoming the male actor with the most Oscar nominations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Nicholson

questions.question: For which of the following two movies did Denzel Washington win Oscars?

options.text: The Mighty Quinn and A Soldiers Story

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glory and Training Day

questions.question: In the 2004 action/adventure movie National Treasure, where do the Gates send Ian to seek the treasure, (which is on a wild goose chase), when the treasure cannot be found beneath the church?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The North Church

questions.question: In the 2004 movie National Treasure, what was hidden behind the brick at the clock tower?

options.text: A piece of the Liberty Bell

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ben Franklins unique glasses

questions.question: Which of Abigails collections does Ben Gates contribute to in the movie National Treasure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coin shaped pin

questions.question: Which actor plays officer Sadusky, the mason who happens to be serving as the chief police detective in the 2004 movie National Treasure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvey Keitel

questions.question: Which American actress received her 13th Academy Award nomination in 2003?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meryl Streep

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Bandit and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, afi. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Made in 1952 in black and white, this movie is the highest ranked western film (# 33) among the AFI Top 100 American movies.

options.text: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: High Noon

questions.question: Which musical, directed by Robert Wise, is ranked # 41 on the AFI Top 100 list?

options.text: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Side Story

questions.question: Which family of performers and musicians contributed the most to the Top 100 AFI films?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Coppolas

questions.question: Which actor played Buford T. Justice, the sheriff who was in hot pursuit of the Bandit in the 1977 film Smokey and the Bandit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jackie Gleason

questions.question: Who was the only African-American awarded an Oscar for an acting performance in one of the 100 American films on AFIs list?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hattie McDaniel

questions.question: Which actor, featured in Its  A Wonderful Life (1946) appeared in the most Top 100 American films?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ward Bond

questions.question: What do the following classic movies have in common: Spartacus, Rosemarys Baby, The Magnificent Seven, and The Ten Commandments?

options.text: They were all written by Ed Wood.
They were all made for under five million dollars.
None of them made it to the Top 100 list.
They were all made in the 1960s.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of them made it to the Top 100 list.

questions.question: Which is the only original movie, included in the AFI Top 100 list, together with its sequel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Godfather and Godfather  II

questions.question: In Smokey and the Bandit, after Cletus and the Bandit win the bet, they take a double-or-nothing offer from Big and Little Enos to retrieve clam chowder from Boston.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who is the only person to have two movies among the top 15 on the AFI 100 list, written and directed by him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Wilder

questions.question: The 1927 movie The Jazz Singer, ranked #90 on the AFI list, is famous primarily for what?

options.text: It co-starred Charlie Chaplin as himself.
It was the first color film.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was the first talkie.

questions.question: According to the movie Smokey and the Bandit, in CB radio speak, a 10-100 means you have to use the bathroom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the movie Smokey and the Bandit, Sally Fields character complained that she didnt have a CB handle or nickname. What nickname did the Bandit give her?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frog

questions.question: What is the CB radio handle of  Cletus Snow, the character portrayed by Jerry Reid in the movie Smokey and the Bandit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snowman

questions.question: Who is the only director to have five of his movies listed among the Top 100 movies according to AFI?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steven Spielberg

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Airplane and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, emergency, appearance. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Smokey and the Bandit, the characters from the self-titled movie, had to take beer from Texarkana, Texas and to deliver it to which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlanta, GA

questions.question: In the film Smokey and the Bandit, in order to do what cant be done, the Bandit and Cletus had to deliver the beer within how many hours?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 28

questions.question: Who makes a cameo appearance at the beginning of the movie Airplane!, as a member of the airport ground crew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Zucker

questions.question: In the movie Smokey and the Bandit, Big and Little Enos offer the Bandit $80,000 to bring them what cargo within a specified time limit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 400 cases of Coors beer

questions.question: What was Sally Fields character in Smokey and the Bandit wearing, when the Bandit picked her up on the side of the road?

options.text: Short shorts and a halter top

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A wedding dress and veil

questions.question: Name the two characters speaking in the audio soundbite from the movie Airplane!.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Rumak and Elaine

questions.question: In the hit comedy movie Airplane!, Randy the stewardess (played by Lorna Patterson) had a hard time communicating with the two gravely ill jive dudes because she didnt speak jive. Who had to step in and translate the jive talk for Randy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbara Billingsley

questions.question: What was the last name of Clarks family in the National Lampoons Vacation series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Griswold

questions.question: The Bandits real name is never mentioned in the movie Smokey and the Bandit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the movie Airplane!, the sick child was played by actress Jill Whelan and her caring mother was played by Joyce Bulifant. These two actresses have a connection with Gavin MacLeod. They both have co-starred with him on separate television shows during their careers. Name the two TV shows.

options.text: The Big Valley and Hawaii Five-0
The Mary Tyler Moore Show and The Love Boat

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Mary Tyler Moore Show and The Love Boat

questions.question: What was the reason for the emergency landing in the movie Airplane!?

options.text: A sudden drop in cabin pressure caused the flight crew to become unconscious.
The flight crew became violently ill after having fish for dinner.
Smoke in the cockpit caused the flight crew to become unconscious.
The planes core computer malfunctioned and systemically disabled the flight crew.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The flight crew became violently ill after having fish for dinner.

questions.question: David Letterman screen tested for the role of Ted Striker in the movie Airplane!, ultimately played by Robert Hays.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What famous NBA basketball star made an appearance as co-pilot Murdock in the movie Airplane!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

questions.question: In the hit comedy movie Airplane!, air traffic controller Steve McCroskey (played by Lloyd Bridges) was under severe stress trying to bring the airplane in safely. Each time he was placed under stress, he would medicate himself and exclaim, that he had picked the wrong week to quit his various addictions. To which of the following was McCroskey not addicted?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: shooting heroin

questions.question: The comedy movie Airplane! is a spoof of several movies including Airport 75 and Jaws, but which 1957 movie did the directors claim it most closely resembled?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zero Hour

questions.question: What was George and Marys last name in the movie, Its a Wonderful Life?

questions.question: What was the surname of Tonys family featured in the movie Saturday Night Fever?

questions.question: What was the surname of the detective in the series of movies which featured a Honolulu super sleuth and his sons?

questions.question: In the movie A Few Good Men, a marine was killed by two fellow marines. What was the  last name of the soldier who was killed?

questions.question: What was the name of the fictional early 19th century Swiss family who was shipwrecked on a desert island in the south Pacific?

questions.question: What was the name of Scouts family in the 1962 classic To Kill a Mockingbird?

questions.question: Who was the actress starring in And Your Mother Too (Y Tu Mama Tambien)?
